about_the_game:
Dreamland is a 2D sci-fi adventure game that combines character development, equipment acquisition and enhancement, world exploration, and map collection. Players will take on the role of an artificial life form with the aim of eliminating dangers on the planet and establishing a new home.

Game Systems


Random Maps
Maps are generated procedurally and are completely random.

Dangerous Areas
The game is divided into multiple dangerous areas of different levels, with varying enemy strengths. More dangerous areas yield more powerful items. Players can unlock teleportation or overcome obstacles to access higher-risk areas earlier.

Changeable Terrain
Players can modify the terrain to aid their objectives.

Resource Collection
Players can collect various items on the map to support combat.

Hidden Area Resources
There are items hidden by team members on the map, allowing players to obtain large amounts of resources at once.

Traps
Traps exist on the map, so players should explore carefully while collecting resources.

Detailed Maps
The game provides both mini-maps and large-scale maps. The mini-map allows players to quickly view unexplored areas, while the large-scale map provides a broader view of the entire planet, along with filtering functions to help players understand the terrain.

Customizable Campfires
Players can set teleportation points according to their needs.

Messages
Team members will tell players about the past, helping them understand the world and the backgrounds of the team members.

Blocking Communication
Players can choose to focus solely on combat and exploration, ignoring other matters.

Seasonal Changes
Terrain changes with the seasons; previously blocked areas open up, and the availability of resources changes. Players need to plan accordingly.

Temperature System
Both high and low temperatures threaten survival, so choosing the right time and place to act is crucial.

Four-Way Movement
Players and enemies can only move up, down, left, or right on the map.

Real-Time Turn-Based Combat
Players and enemies take turns moving, and time passes accordingly. Players can increase their speed and actions through leveling up or equipment.

Danger Level
Players accumulate their own danger level by killing enemies, attracting increasingly powerful enemies.

Death Penalty
Players lose their level when they die, but all collected items are retained.

Character Leveling
By consuming energy, players strengthen their bodies. After reaching a certain level of accumulation, they can randomly gain ability upgrades.

Multiple Weapons
Various styles of weapons can be used to deal with different situations. Choosing the right weapon is crucial to overcoming obstacles.

Multiple Attributes
The game offers various attribute damages, each with unique effects and interactions.

Weapon Cores
By combining weapon cores, players can create weapons that better suit their characteristics.

Grenades and Mines
The game offers various grenades and mines as supplementary attack methods.

Runes
Numerous runes can be obtained through map exploration, and the rune system can further change one's attack form.

Regular Store Refresh
The store's items are regularly updated. Visiting the store while exploring is a good choice.

Parasites
Dangerous creatures on the planet can enhance our abilities when used properly. Parasites need to be fed and can be upgraded.

Altars
Mysterious creations of the natives can bring us many conveniences, such as resurrection and altering parasites.

Item Crafting
Players can use materials they collect to craft advanced items.

Mutation
When exposed to pollution, players' genes will change, resulting in ability changes upon regeneration.

Kill Drops
Enemies killed by different types of damage drop different materials. Adjusting one's attack method is necessary to obtain the desired materials.

Multiple Endings
The game offers multiple choices, and players do not necessarily have to follow orders; fate is in their hands.

Background Music
The game offers a variety of music, allowing players to choose their favorites.

Damage Statistics
The game system records players' damage situations, helping them improve their strategies.

Regular Saving
The game automatically saves progress at regular intervals, allowing players to potentially recover from mistakes.
